meanings.definition: One who acts or transacts business for another; an agent.
meanings.sent1: The factor helped the company with its financial transactions.
meanings.sent2: The factor negotiated a deal on behalf of the client.
meanings.sent3: The factor made sure all the paperwork was in order, even adding a touch of humor to the process.
meanings.sent4: She was like a well-oiled machine, a factor of efficiency in the office.
meanings.sent5: The factor's attention to detail was unmatched, making him indispensable to the team.

meanings.definition: One who transacts business for another; an agent.
meanings.sent1: The factor handled all the financial matters for the company.
meanings.sent2: As a factor, he was responsible for securing profitable deals.
meanings.sent3: The factor always had a knack for finding the best bargains, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent4: She was the secret factor behind the company's success, working tirelessly behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: His role as a factor was crucial in ensuring smooth operations for the business.
